== thorwil's backgrounds ==

A Collection of Backgrounds in various stages of refinement. Most of them are meant to be in line with the briefing provided by Kenneth Wimer.

In short: inviting, progressive, balanced, refined, elegant. With a palette of mainly brown tones.

Possible sources of inspiration are the features coming with 9.04: the faster boot time, online services, the new notification system.

Everything shall be licensed as LGPL or CC BY SA (Creative Commons Attribution Share Alike) in any specific version as required ;)

All my sources can be found at https://code.launchpad.net/~t-w-/ubuntu-artwork/backgrounds

<nowiki>[[attachment:wakojakoo_ubuntu_+peerspective_gradient_1920_1080.jpg|Fullsize]]</nowiki>

===== Comments =====

* I had to rename the file to have the .jpg at the end, as it won't be shown in the browser otherwise ;) Well, there's a rather strong consensus in the ubuntu-artwork community that the logo and Ubuntu label shouldn't take center stage. There's enough branding elsewhere and having this constantly in the background doesn't make us look confident. -- <nowiki>[[LaunchpadHome:t-w-]]</nowiki>
